definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: My counsel asked the doorkeeper if he, too, hadn't smoked.
sentences.chinese: 这时，我的律师问门房是否和我一道抽烟了。

sentences.english: LaoJiangHu ghost uncle, is before the sword, is now home TiTouJiang descends to the porter.
sentences.chinese: 老江湖鬼叔，以前是刀家的门房，现已沦落为剃头匠。

sentences.english: I enquired at the porters' lodge. A middle-aged man with a kindly face came forward.
sentences.chinese: 我到门房去打听，一位和蔼善良的中年人走上前来。

sentences.english: After which the doorkeeper went back to his seat.
sentences.chinese: 门房回到他的座位上去。

sentences.english: He is the son of Quebec actor Manuel Tadros.
sentences.chinese: 我看演员表上演的是门房，到底哪位是他爸？

sentences.english: Guests pass through a gatehouse and then travel down a path that leads to a lodge, the main home and a guest dwelling.
sentences.chinese: 客人从门房穿过，然后通过一条小路到达主人的居所。

sentences.english: The concièrge closed the door, leaving Madame Danglars in the street.
sentences.chinese: 那门房关上门，让腾格拉尔夫人站在街上。

sentences.english: When does the porter open that door?
sentences.chinese: 什么时候门房才开那扇门呢？

sentences.english: The porter had to force the window open every morning.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨门房只好用力硬把窗户打开。

sentences.english: Family and children's activities can be arranged through the concierge.
sentences.chinese: 家庭及孩子们的活动均由门房组织策划。

sentences.english: In the interior, beyond the barricades, the wine-shops and porters' lodges were converted into guard-houses.
sentences.chinese: 在一些街垒的内部，那些酒厅和门房都变成了警卫室。

definition: reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
door/doorman (old)/hanger-on of an aristocrat/social influence/pull/classifier for relatives, marriages etc
to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
(old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
